fields.name: The Maltese Falcon
fields.author: Dashiell Hammett
fields.description: A hard-boiled detective novel featuring Sam Spade on the trail of a priceless statuette.

fields.name: The Big Sleep
fields.author: Raymond Chandler
fields.description: Private detective Philip Marlowe investigates blackmail and murder in Los Angeles.

fields.name: Double Indemnity
fields.author: James M. Cain
fields.description: An insurance salesman is lured into a murderous scheme by a femme fatale.

fields.name: Murder on the Orient Express
fields.author: Agatha Christie
fields.description: Detective Hercule Poirot investigates a murder on a snowbound train.

fields.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
fields.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
fields.description: Sherlock Holmes investigates a supernatural hound terrorizing a family on the moors.

fields.name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
fields.author: Stieg Larsson
fields.description: A journalist and a hacker investigate a decades-old disappearance.

fields.name: Gone Girl
fields.author: Gillian Flynn
fields.description: A woman disappears on her wedding anniversary, leaving her husband as the prime suspect.

fields.name: The Silence of the Lambs
fields.author: Thomas Harris
fields.description: FBI trainee Clarice Starling seeks help from an imprisoned cannibal to catch a serial killer.

fields.name: The Da Vinci Code
fields.author: Dan Brown
fields.description: A symbologist races to solve a murder and uncover a conspiracy involving a secret society.

fields.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
fields.author: Harper Lee
fields.description: A young girl's coming-of-age story set against the backdrop of racial injustice in the American South.

fields.author: George Orwell
fields.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where critical thought is suppressed.

fields.name: The Great Gatsby
fields.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
fields.description: A tale of decadence and excess in America's Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth and the American Dream.

fields.name: The Book Thief
fields.author: Markus Zusak
fields.description: The story of a young girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace in stealing books and sharing them with others.

fields.name: Wolf Hall
fields.author: Hilary Mantel
fields.description: A fictionalized biography of Thomas Cromwell in the court of Henry VIII.

fields.name: The Pillars of the Earth
fields.author: Ken Follett
fields.description: An epic tale of ambition and love set against the building of a cathedral in 12th-century England.

fields.name: The Kite Runner
fields.author: Khaled Hosseini
fields.description: A story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history.

fields.name: The Goldfinch
fields.author: Donna Tartt
fields.description: A coming-of-age novel about a young man's journey through loss, love, and the underground art world.

fields.name: Normal People
fields.author: Sally Rooney
fields.description: A complex love story exploring the subtleties of class and the electricity of first love in modern-day Ireland.

fields.name: Pride and Prejudice
fields.author: Jane Austen
fields.description: A witty romance set in Georgian England, exploring themes of love, marriage, and social class.

fields.name: Great Expectations
fields.author: Charles Dickens
fields.description: A coming-of-age story following an orphan boy's journey through life in Victorian England.

fields.name: Wuthering Heights
fields.author: Emily Bront�
fields.description: A passionate and dark tale of love and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.

fields.name: The Great Gatsby
fields.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
fields.description: A critique of the American Dream set in the Roaring Twenties.

fields.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
fields.author: Harper Lee
fields.description: A powerful exploration of racial injustice and loss of innocence in the American South.

fields.author: George Orwell
fields.description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian future where critical thought is suppressed.

fields.name: The Odyssey
fields.author: Homer
fields.description: An epic poem following Odysseus's long journey home after the Trojan War.

fields.name: Medea
fields.author: Euripides
fields.description: A Greek tragedy exploring themes of revenge, love, and the position of women in society.

fields.name: The Aeneid
fields.author: Virgil
fields.description: An epic poem recounting the legendary story of Aeneas, a Trojan who traveled to Italy and became the ancestor of the Romans.

fields.name: The Martian
fields.author: Andy Weir
fields.description: An astronaut stranded on Mars uses his ingenuity to survive while NASA and a team of scientists work to bring him home.

fields.name: Rendezvous with Rama
fields.author: Arthur C. Clarke
fields.description: A team of astronauts explores a mysterious cylindrical object that enters the solar system, discovering its secrets and potential alien origins.

fields.name: Neuromancer
fields.author: William Gibson
fields.description: A groundbreaking cyberpunk novel following a washed-up computer hacker hired for one last job, exploring themes of artificial intelligence and virtual reality.

fields.name: Dune
fields.author: Frank Herbert
fields.description: An epic science fiction saga set on a desert planet, exploring politics, religion, and ecology as houses vie for control of a valuable resource.

fields.name: Foundation
fields.author: Isaac Asimov
fields.description: The first book in a series chronicling the collapse and rebirth of a vast interstellar empire, based on the principles of psychohistory.

fields.name: Ender's Game
fields.author: Orson Scott Card
fields.description: A young boy is trained in a battle school to become humanity's last hope against an alien threat, exploring themes of leadership and morality.

fields.name: The Handmaid's Tale
fields.author: Margaret Atwood
fields.description: Set in a near-future totalitarian society, the novel follows a woman forced into sexual servitude in a world of declining birth rates.

fields.name: Brave New World
fields.author: Aldous Huxley
fields.description: A classic dystopian novel depicting a genetically engineered society addicted to pleasure and conformity.

fields.name: The Hunger Games
fields.author: Suzanne Collins
fields.description: In a dystopian future, young people are forced to participate in a televised battle to the death as entertainment for the ruling class.

fields.name: Seveneves
fields.author: Neal Stephenson
fields.description: When the moon explodes, humanity has two years to get off Earth before debris rains down. The story follows the survivors' 5000-year journey in space.

fields.name: The Three-Body Problem
fields.author: Cixin Liu
fields.description: Set against the backdrop of China's Cultural Revolution, a secret military project sends signals into space to establish contact with aliens.

fields.name: Blindsight
fields.author: Peter Watts
fields.description: A crew of transhuman scientists is sent to investigate a mysterious alien object on the edge of the solar system.

fields.name: Leviathan Wakes
fields.author: James S. A. Corey
fields.description: The first book in The Expanse series, following a ship's captain and a detective as they unravel a conspiracy that threatens the entire solar system.

fields.name: Ancillary Justice
fields.author: Ann Leckie
fields.description: The story of Breq, an AI and sole survivor of a starship destroyed by treachery, on a quest for revenge.

fields.name: The Long Way to a Small, Angry Planet
fields.author: Becky Chambers
fields.description: A character-driven space adventure following the crew of a ship that creates wormholes for interstellar travel.

fields.name: The Road
fields.author: Cormac McCarthy
fields.description: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic America, facing dangers and moral dilemmas as they struggle to survive.

fields.name: Station Eleven
fields.author: Emily St. John Mandel
fields.description: Set in the Great Lakes region after a fictional swine flu pandemic has devastated the world, following a traveling Shakespeare troupe.

fields.name: The Windup Girl
fields.author: Paolo Bacigalupi
fields.description: In a future Thailand, a calorie company man and a genetically modified woman become pawns in a larger political game.

fields.name: ane Eyre
fields.author: Charlotte Bront�
fields.description: A Gothic romance following the life of its eponymous heroine, from her troubled childhood to her relationship with the mysterious Mr. Rochester.

fields.name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
fields.author: Oscar Wilde
fields.description: A philosophical novel about a man who sells his soul to maintain his youth and beauty while his portrait ages.

fields.name: Moby-Dick
fields.author: Herman Melville
fields.description: An epic tale of obsession and adventure, following Captain Ahab's quest for revenge against a giant white whale.

fields.name: Brave New World
fields.author: Aldous Huxley
fields.description: A dystopian novel set in a genetically engineered future where society is divided into castes and individuality is suppressed.

fields.name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
fields.author: Gabriel Garc�a M�rquez
fields.description: A multi-generational saga of the Buend�a family, blending magical realism with Colombian history.

fields.name: The Grapes of Wrath
fields.author: John Steinbeck
fields.description: A powerful novel depicting a family's journey during the Great Depression and the Dust Bowl migration.

fields.name: The Iliad
fields.author: Homer
fields.description: An ancient Greek epic poem set during the Trojan War, focusing on the wrath of Achilles.

fields.name: Oedipus Rex
fields.author: Sophocles
fields.description: A Greek tragedy that tells the story of King Oedipus and his tragic fall from grace.

fields.name: The Art of War
fields.author: Sun Tzu
fields.description: An ancient Chinese military treatise filled with strategy and wisdom applicable beyond warfare.

fields.name: Beloved
fields.author: Toni Morrison
fields.description: A powerful and haunting novel about a former slave and the lingering trauma of slavery in 19th-century America.

fields.name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
fields.author: Gabriel Garc�a M�rquez
fields.description: A multi-generational saga of the Buend�a family, blending magical realism with Colombian history.

fields.name: The Catcher in the Rye
fields.author: J.D. Salinger
fields.description: A classic coming-of-age story following the experiences of Holden Caulfield in New York City.

fields.name: All the Light We Cannot See
fields.author: Anthony Doerr
fields.description: A blind French girl and a German boy's paths collide in occupied France during World War II.

fields.name: The Nightingale
fields.author: Kristin Hannah
fields.description: Two sisters in France must make life-altering decisions as they struggle for survival during World War II.

fields.name: Outlander
fields.author: Diana Gabaldon
fields.description: A World War II nurse is transported back in time to 18th-century Scotland, where she falls in love with a Highland warrior.

fields.name: The Underground Railroad
fields.author: Colson Whitehead
fields.description: A reimagining of the Underground Railroad as a literal subway system for escaping slaves in the antebellum South.

fields.name: The Nickel Boys
fields.author: Colson Whitehead
fields.description: Based on a real reform school, this novel follows two boys navigating the horrors of a Jim Crow-era juvenile reformatory.

fields.name: Little Fires Everywhere
fields.author: Celeste Ng
fields.description: The intertwined fates of the picture-perfect Richardson family and an enigmatic mother and daughter who upend their lives.

fields.name: The Postman Always Rings Twice
fields.author: James M. Cain
fields.description: A drifter conspires with a married woman to murder her husband in this classic of hard-boiled fiction.

fields.name: The Long Goodbye
fields.author: Raymond Chandler
fields.description: Private detective Philip Marlowe gets involved with a drunk, his beautiful wife, and murder in this complex noir tale.

fields.name: The Killer Inside Me
fields.author: Jim Thompson
fields.description: A chilling first-person narrative of a deputy sheriff's descent into violence and madness.

fields.name: And Then There Were None
fields.author: Agatha Christie
fields.description: Ten strangers are lured to an isolated island and accused of past crimes as they start to die one by one.

fields.name: The Name of the Rose
fields.author: Umberto Eco
fields.description: A medieval monk investigates a series of murders at a monastery using the analytical methods of Sherlock Holmes.

fields.name: In the Woods
fields.author: Tana French
fields.description: A detective returns to his hometown to solve a murder case linked to his own traumatic past.

fields.name: The Girl on the Train
fields.author: Paula Hawkins
fields.description: A woman becomes entangled in a missing person's investigation that promises to send shockwaves through her life.

fields.name: Before I Go to Sleep
fields.author: S.J. Watson
fields.description: An amnesiac attempts to reconstruct her past only to discover dark secrets in this psychological thriller.

fields.name: The Firm
fields.author: John Grisham
fields.description: A young lawyer joins a prestigious firm only to discover it's involved in illegal activities.
